################## Starting Experiment ##################
Configurations are:
Namespace(all=False, API_KEY='utils/api/API_KEY', bound=2, cross=False, delay=5, envs=[0], eval=False, exp_src=None, gpt=['0'], input=False, log=True, neg_memo=False, prj_name='LLM As Agent', screen=640, seed=23, steps=[200], temp=[0.7], view=[7], wandb=True)
Your mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. Please provide me with the initial world map and your current position (X, Y) and facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West, or Down/South) so that we can begin our adventure!Follow formats in previous examples, describe about it.

 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -]
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -]
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -]
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
2. Inventory You are holding nothing

There is also a locked green door four spaces in front of you. You are not holding anything in yourChoose an action or a mutiple step actions plan from the following to exlore the environment as much as you can: 
(0) left: turn your view to the left object
(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.
Limit your reason to be less than 100 tokens.
Use format like: I choose to do (a)  Action XX (b)  Action XX .... Choose one action or multiple actions is totally up to youselfI choose to do (3) forward and (0) left actions. 

Reason: By moving forward, I can explore the space in front of me and potentially discover new objects or areas. Additionally, by turning left, I can expand my field of view and gather more information about the surrounding objects and their properties. 2. Inventory You are holding nothing 
3. Past actions forward, left, pick up, left, forward, forward 
4. Gained experience Comparing my new experience with my previous experience, I now know that there is an empty space in front of me. This provides me with the opportunity to move forward and potentially uncover new objects or paths. Additionally, I have gained a key and encountered a ball in my previous actions. Utilizing these items and interacting with the ball may lead to further discoveries or access to locked areas. By combining my past experiences with my current knowledge, I can continue exploring the world with a greater understanding and strategic approach

Map: Walls surround the room. In front of me, to the left, there's a green ball and a locked green door. I'm standingChoose an action or a mutiple step actions plan from the following to exlore the environment as much as you can: 
(0) left: turn your view to the left object
(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.

This provides me with the opportunity to move forward and potentially uncover new objects or paths. Additionally, I have gained a key and encountered a ball in my previous actions. Utilizing these items and interacting with the ball may lead to further discoveries or access to locked areas. By combining my past experiences with my current knowledge, I can continue exploring the world with a greater understanding and strategic approachYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward

You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

These observations allow me to plan my next actions strategically, considering the potential obstacles and opportunitiesYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. Limit your description to be less than 50 tokens in total.World ID: #0, Position: (1, 2), Facing: Up/North.
Map: Grey walls surround the entire area. An empty space, a ball, and a locked door are in front of me. (41 tokens)
Choose an action or a mutiple step actions plan from the following to exlore the environment as much as you can: 
(0) left: turn your view to the left object
(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.
Limit your reason to be less than 100 tokens.
Use format like: I choose to do (a)  Action XX (b)  Action XX .... Choose one action or multiple actions is totally up to youselfI choose to do (1) right: turn your view to the right object.

Reason: By turning my view to the right, I can gather more information about the objects and potential paths in the environment. This will allow me to have a better understanding of my surroundings and potentially discover new objects or openings that were previously hidden from my view. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object.

I will continue to strategize my actions based on these findings and aim to uncover more hidden objects and paths as I progress.Your mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory

 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.

a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+).

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]

 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]]

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object.

(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory

I will continue exploring and gatheringYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.
Limit your reason to be less than 100 tokens.
Use format like: I choose to do (a)  Action XX (b)  Action XX .... Choose one action or multiple actions is totally up to youselfI choose to do the following actions to explore the environment:
(0) right: turn my view to the right object
(3) forward: move myself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object

I choose to turn my view to the right object first because it will provide me with a new perspective and potentially reveal new paths or objects. After that, I will move forward to explore the object in front of me. To progress further, I need to continue exploring and searching for keys or alternative paths.Your mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object.

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward

World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. 1. World Map 
[[- - - - - - - - - - -]
 [5Wall 0Empty - - - - - - - - -]
 [5Wall 0Empty - - - - - - - - -]
 [5Wall 0Empty - - - - - - - - -]
 [5Wall Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty - - - - - -]
 [5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - - -]] 
2. Inventory You are holding nothing 
3. Past actions forward, toggle, forward, right, left, forward, toggle, forward, right 
4. Gained experience Comparing my new experience with my previous experience, I have learned that turning left and right allows me to uncover additional empty spaces. Moving forward multiple times can lead to discovering more empty spaces and potential objects. Toggling objects does not seem to have a significant impact. Based on this, I should continue exploring unexplored areas, experiment with different actions, and be open to discovering new objects and spaces in the environment.

(0) left: turn your view to the left object
(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.

1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. Please provide me with the initial world map and your current position (X, Y) and facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West, or Down/South) so that we can begin our adventure!Follow formats in previous examples, describe about it.

  -]

 [5Wall 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -]
 [5Wall 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -]
 [5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
2. Inventory You are holding nothing 
3. Past actions toggle, forward, left, toggle, forward, left, forward, toggle, forward 
4. Gained experience Comparing my new experience with my previous experience, I have learned that toggling objects can reveal hidden items, such as the key (1Key) that I found earlier. Moving forward has allowed me to uncover new empty spaces. Additionally, I have encountered a locked green door (1Door+), indicating the possibility of an unexplored area behind it.    [[5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - -Choose an action or a mutiple step actions plan from the following to exlore the environment as much as you can: 
(0) left: turn your view to the left object
(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.
Limit your reason to be less than 100 tokens.

1. Toggle: I will toggle the object in front of me to uncover any hidden items or paths.
2. Forward: If the object in front of me is empty or opened, I will move forward to explore further.
3. Left: I will turn my view to the left object to expand my field of vision and potentially discover new objects or paths.

I should also keep in mind the possibility of finding keys to unlockYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. (4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory

To continue exploring, I should prioritize investigating the surroundings and searching for any potential items or paths that may lead to further discoveries. Additionally, I should remain cautious of any locked doors or obstacles that may require specific actions or items to overcome.Your mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. To continue my exploration, I should prioritize moving forward and thoroughly investigate the surroundings for any clues, keys, or unlocked doors that may lead to further progress in this world.Your mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

To continue my exploration, I will prioritize investigating the unexplored areas and focus on finding and unlocking the locked doors using the key.Your mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. I will also remain open toYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

I will also remain open toYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+).

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.

You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

I need to continue utilizing my past knowledge and be proactive in toggling objects to uncover the secrets of this world. Additionally, I should keep track of my surroundings and use my inventory wisely to overcome any obstacles that may arise.Your mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory

0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. Please provide me with the initial world map and your current position (X, Y) and facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West, or Down/South) so that we can begin our adventure!Follow formats in previous examples, describe about it. 
0. World ID is # 0 and your position is (4, 3), facing Right/East. 
1. World Map 
[[- - - - - - - - - - -]
 [5Wall 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Door+ - - - -
  -]
 [5Wall 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Key 5Wall - - - - -]
 [5Wall 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -]
 [5Wall 0Empty 0Empty Yourself 0Empty 5Wall - - - -
  -]
 [5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
2. Inventory You are holding nothing 
3. Past actions left, forward, toggle, left, toggle, forward, pick up, toggle, forward 
4. Gained experience Comparing my new experience with my previous experience, I have learned that toggling objects can reveal hidden paths and uncover new areas. By combining this action with moving forward, I can maximize my exploration and uncover potential paths or valuable items. Additionally, I should keep track of my surroundings and use my inventory wisely to overcome any obstacles that may arise. The discovery of the key suggests that there may be locked doors in the environment that can be opened with the key. I need to continue utilizing my past knowledge

0. World ID: #0, Position: (4, 3), Facing: Right/East.
1. World Map: Walls surround the room. There is a green locked door (1Door+) to the right. AChoose an action or a mutiple step actions plan from the following to exlore the environment as much as you can: 
(0) left: turn your view to the left object
(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.
Limit your reason to be less than 100 tokens.

Moving forward allows me to explore the environment and potentially uncover new areas or objects. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.
