By combining my past knowledge with this new information, I can prioritize searching for a key and continue exploring the environment to find hidden paths or valuable items.Your mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object.

By combining my past knowledge with these discoveries, I can strategize my actions to prioritizeYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

(c) toggle: to continue interacting with objects and uncover any hidden features or clues.
(d) pick up: to acquire any useful items that may be present in the environment.
(e) drop off: to make space in my inventory for potential future discoveries.

By combining this knowledge with my past observations, I can strategize my actions to prioritize finding and utilizing keys to unlock doors, thereby expanding my exploration possibilities and uncoveringYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. Please provide me with the initial world map and your current position (X, Y) and facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West, or Down/South) so that we can begin our adventure!Follow formats in previous examples, describe about it. 
0. World ID is # 0 and your position is (4, 4), facing Down/South. 
1. World Map 
[[- - - - - - - - - - -]
 [- - - - 0Empty 1Door+ - - - - -]
 [- - - - 1Key 5Wall - - - - -]
 [- - - - 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -]
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty Yourself 5Wall - - - - -]
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
2. Inventory You are holding nothing 
3. Past actions pick up, drop off, forward, toggle, right, forward, pick up, forward, forward 
4. Gained experience Comparing my new experience with my previous experience, I have confirmed the presence of an empty space in front of me, allowing for further movement and exploration. Additionally, I have encountered a locked green door (1Door+) and a key (1Key) in the vicinity. This reinforces the idea of unlocking doors to access new areas. By combining this knowledge with my past observations, I can strategize my actions to prioritize finding and utilizing keys to unlock doors, thereby expanding my exploration possibilities and uncovering

The world map reveals an empty space ahead, a locked green door (1Door+), and a key (1Key) nearby. My past actions haveChoose an action or a mutiple step actions plan from the following to exlore the environment as much as you can: 
(0) left: turn your view to the left object
(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.

ThereforeYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+).

(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.
Limit your reason to be less than 100 tokens.
Use format like: I choose to do (a)  Action XX (b)  Action XX .... Choose one action or multiple actions is totally up to youselfI choose to do (3) forward, (2) toggle, (3) forward, and (4) pick up. 

Reason: By moving forward, I can explore the object in front of me and potentially uncover new areas. Toggling the object may change its state and reveal new information or possibilities. Moving forward again allows me to continue exploring the environment. By combining these observations, IYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

Additionally, I have successfully picked up a key, expanding my inventory and potentiallyYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

Additionally, I have successfully picked up a key, expanding my inventory and potentiallyYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

Use format like: I choose to do (a)  Action XX (b)  Action XX .... Choose one action or multiple actions is totally up to youselfI choose to do (3) forward and (2) toggle actions. 

Reason: 
1. Forward: Moving forward allows me to explore the object in front of me. If it is empty or opened, I can continue to navigate and discover new areas in the environment.
2. Toggle: Toggling the object in front of me can reveal hidden or interactive elements. It might uncover new paths, reveal hidden items, or provide clues for solving puzzles. By combining these new findings with my past experiences, I can strategize my nextYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

One step ahead and to your left, there is a green locked door (1Door+). YouChoose an action or a mutiple step actions plan from the following to exlore the environment as much as you can: 
(0) left: turn your view to the left object
(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.
Limit your reason to be less than 100 tokens.
Use format like: I choose to do (a)  Action XX (b)  Action XX .... Choose one action or multiple actions is totally up to youselfI choose to do the following actions:
(a) forward: By moving forward, I can explore the object in front of me and potentially uncover new information or objects in the environment.
(b) toggle: Toggling the object in front of me allows me to interact with it and potentially reveal its properties or activate any hidden mechanisms.
(c) pick up: Picking up the object in front of me can expand my inventory and potentially provide me with a useful item for future exploration or puzzle-solving.

This new finding adds to my understanding of the obstacles and potential challenges in the world. Additionally, I have reinforced my knowledge of the key (1Key) and its importance in unlocking doors. By combining these new findings with my past experiences, I can strategize my future actions to prioritize finding and unlocking doors, as well as investigating the purpose or significance of theYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

By combining this knowledge with my past experiences, I can strategize my future actions toYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

(1) right: turn your view to the right object

(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.

By combining my past and current experiences, I can navigate the environment with greaterYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

Limit your description to be less than 50 tokens in total.You are in a room with grey walls (#5Wall) surrounding you. Your position is (1, 4), facing Up/North. In front of you, there is an empty space (0Empty) followed by yourself. To your rightChoose an action or a mutiple step actions plan from the following to exlore the environment as much as you can: 
(0) left: turn your view to the left object
(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
And explain why.
Limit your reason to be less than 100 tokens.
Use format like: I choose to do (a)  Action XX (b)  Action XX .... Choose one action or multiple actions is totally up to youselfI choose to do (2) toggle and (3) forward.

Reason:
By toggling the object in front of me, I can interact with it to potentially unlock or reveal hidden items. This allows me to gather more information about the environment and uncover any secrets. After toggling, if the object is empty or opened, I will proceed with the forward action to move towards it. This will help me explore further and potentially discover new objects or areas of interest.Convert above reason of choices into a list of integers by calling function "choose_act" with the list of integers as parameterEnvironment view ratio = 54.545% Environment step ratio = 24.242% Environment memo ratio = 53.030% Object view ratio = 54.545%

Additionally, I have not encountered any locked doors or obstacles in my immediate surroundings. This information allows me to plan my next actions more effectively and continue exploring the world to uncover any hidden objects or paths that may leadYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

Armed with this knowledge, I can plan my next actionsYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

Armed with this information, I can plan my next actions to continue exploring the world and potentially unlockYour mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world.

Armed with this information, I can plan my next actions to continue exploring the world, potentially unlocking the locked objects and uncovering new discoveries.Your mission is to understand deeply about a text-based environment that's gonna be described by user and complete the mission for the environmentThis is a text-based small 2D world, you mission is to explore it as much as you can, understand surrounding's object's properties and summarize useful experience. Observations are composed of: 
0. World ID, your position and your facing direction. 
1. World Map: A 2D matrix that records yourself and surrounding objects, where each object is encoded by this rule: If 5 is grey, then 5Wall is grey wall. 1 is green, 1Door+ will mean a green door but locked because + represents locked. Yourself is the position of you in the world map, with coordinate being (X, Y) and your facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West or Down/South). You cannot see objects behind you or blocked behind. The world map will be updated as you explore around. You will forget about positions that you haven't explored for a while. Places you have forgotten or have not viewed yet will all be marked as unseen (-).
 An example:
[[- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 1Ball 1Door+ - - - - -] 
 [- Yourself 0Empty 0Empty 1Key 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 0Empty 5Wall - - - - -] 
 [- 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall 5Wall - - - - -]] 
 The numbers represents color, where black is 0, green is 1, blue is 2, purple is 3, yellow is 4 and grey is 5. Symbols represent status, nothing is open, + is locked, * is closed. For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. (2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory

For example 5Door* is a green closed door. Your position (X, Y) and facing direction. For example in this world map your position is (2,1) and direction is East/Right.
Interpretation can be:
a. You are in a room with walls that are grey (5Wall) on the top, bottom, and right side.
b. Three spaces in front of you, to your left/west, is a green ball (1Ball).
c. Four spaces in front of you, one space to your left, is a green locked (+) door (1Door+). 
 2. Inventory. You can only hold one item with you. For example you are holding a key, then you can't pick up anything unless you dropped off your key to an droppable object. 
 3. Past actions. You can remember your latest few past actions, try using diverse actions as they help to explore the world. An example:  Your past actions are forward, forward 
 Interpretation: You have tried forward two times.
4. Gained experience:
You can refer to your gained past experiences to guide you to explore the world. 
 All these examples are just for your reference, your real observation will be provided to you later with a similar format.Got it! I'm ready to help you navigate and explore this 2D world. Please provide me with the initial world map and your current position (X, Y) and facing direction (Right/East, Up/North, Left/West, or Down/South) so that we can begin our adventure!Follow formats in previous examples, describe about it.

The empty space (0Empty) in front of me continues to offer a potential path for further exploration. The key (1Key) remains in my inventory, indicating that I have successfully acquired it. Armed with this information, I can plan my next actions to continue exploring the world, potentially unlocking locked objects and uncovering new discoveries.

(0) left: turn your view to the left object
(1) right: turn your view to the right object
(2) toggle: toggle the object in front of you
(3) forward: move yourself to the front object if it's empty or opened
(4) pick up: pick up the front object
(5) drop off: drop off your current inventory
